Andy Burnham , the shadow education secretary, said: It is Michael Gove who is stuck in the past, foisting his 1950s vision of education on to today's schools and students. "Parents, teachers and businesses know that alongside solid academic study, young people need technical and social skills to succeed in the workplace and in life. "Labour had made changes to focus the curriculum, with English and maths showing significant improvements. Take-up of single sciences increased significantly in recent years as a result of Labour policies. Mary Bousted , general secretary of the Association of Teachers and Lecturers, said: " Michael Gove 's plans are again full of impossible contradictions. all, Ed Rodgers worked hard and took the high road. " Aaron Rodgers 's a pretty humble guy," said Packers fan Patrick O'Leary , 45, a Cedarsburg, Wis., orthopedic implant salesman. The way Brett Favre carried himself the last four, five years, people around here think he's a diva. "Packers fans are really appreciative of Aaron Rodgers 's demeanor with the way he handled that Brett Favre situation. He's a class act. General manager Ted Thompson and coach Mike McCarthy 's faith in Ed Rodgers has been justified by his seven postseason touchdowns, six passing and one rushing, in out-playing Phil Simmsadelphia's Michael Vick and Atlanta's Matt Ryan .
